value.doc:
Method is the request method, which must be GET or HEAD.
Default is GET.

struct_fields.doc:
Method is the request method, which must be GET or HEAD.
Default is GET.

value.doc: Target is the path to the resource being pushed.

struct_fields.doc: Target is the path to the resource being pushed.

elems.doc: Resource represents a request for a resource to push.

struct_fields.doc: Resource represents a request for a resource to push.

elems.doc: Adds HTTP headers; does not replace any existing header fields.

value.doc:
A Header represents the key-value pairs in an HTTP header.

The keys should be in canonical form, as returned by
CanonicalHeaderKey.

struct_fields.doc: Adds HTTP headers; does not replace any existing header fields.

elems.doc: Sets HTTP headers; replaces existing header fields.

value.doc:
A Header represents the key-value pairs in an HTTP header.

The keys should be in canonical form, as returned by
CanonicalHeaderKey.

struct_fields.doc: Sets HTTP headers; replaces existing header fields.

elems.doc: Names of HTTP header fields to delete.

struct_fields.doc: Names of HTTP header fields to delete.

value.doc: The regular expression to search with.

struct_fields.doc: The regular expression to search with.

value.doc: The string with which to replace matches.

struct_fields.doc: The string with which to replace matches.

elems.doc:
Replacement describes a string replacement,
either a simple and fast substring search
or a slower but more powerful regex search.
Performs substring replacements of HTTP headers in-situ.

struct_fields.doc: Performs substring replacements of HTTP headers in-situ.

value.doc: HeaderConfig configures headers for synthetic push requests.

struct_fields.doc: HeaderConfig configures headers for synthetic push requests.

doc: Handler is a middleware for manipulating the request body.
